semantiva.specializations.audio package

Submodules

semantiva.specializations.audio.audio_data_io module

class semantiva.specializations.audio.audio_data_io.DualChannelAudioSink

Bases: PayloadSink

Abstract base class for dual-channel audio data sinks.

This class defines methods to consume and store dual-channel audio data.

send_data(data)

Consume and store dual-channel audio data.

Parameters:

data (DualChannelAudioDataType) – The audio data to store.

class semantiva.specializations.audio.audio_data_io.DualChannelAudioSource

Bases: PayloadSource

Abstract base class for dual-channel audio data sources.

This class defines methods to provide dual-channel audio data.

get_data()

Fetch and return dual-channel audio data.

Returns:

The encapsulated audio data.

Return type:

DualChannelAudioDataType

class semantiva.specializations.audio.audio_data_io.DualChannelPayloadSink

Bases: PayloadSink

Abstract base class for dual-channel audio payload sinks.

This class defines methods to consume and store payloads containing dual-channel audio data.

send_payload(data, context, *args, **kwargs)

Consume and store a payload of dual-channel audio data.

Parameters:

  • payload (DualChannelAudioDataType) – The audio data payload to store.

  • data (DualChannelAudioDataType)

  • context (ContextType)

semantiva.specializations.audio.audio_data_types module

class semantiva.specializations.audio.audio_data_types.DualChannelAudioDataType(data, *args, **kwargs)

Bases: BaseDataType[ndarray]

Represents dual-channel (stereo) audio data.

This class encapsulates audio data in a dual-channel format, ensuring type consistency and providing a base for operations on such data.

Parameters:

data (ndarray)

_data

The encapsulated dual-channel audio data.

Type:

np.ndarray

validate(data)

Abstract method to validate the encapsulated data.

This method must be implemented by subclasses to define specific validation rules for the data type.

Returns:

True if the data is valid, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

class semantiva.specializations.audio.audio_data_types.SingleChannelAudioDataType(data, *args, **kwargs)

Bases: BaseDataType[ndarray]

Represents single-channel audio data.

This class encapsulates audio data in a single channel (mono) format, ensuring type consistency and providing a base for operations on such data.

Parameters:

data (ndarray)

_data

The encapsulated single-channel audio data.

Type:

np.ndarray

validate(data)

Abstract method to validate the encapsulated data.

This method must be implemented by subclasses to define specific validation rules for the data type.

Returns:

True if the data is valid, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

semantiva.specializations.audio.audio_operations module

class semantiva.specializations.audio.audio_operations.DualChannelAudioAlgorithm(context_observer=None, logger=None)

Bases: DataAlgorithm

An algorithm specialized for processing dual-channel (stereo) audio data.

This class implements the DataAlgorithm abstract base class to define operations that accept and produce DualChannelAudioDataType.

Parameters:

  • context_observer (ContextObserver | None)

  • logger (Logger | None)

input_data_type()

Returns the expected input data type.

output_data_type()

Returns the type of data output by the algorithm.

classmethod input_data_type()

Specify the input data type for the algorithm.

Returns:

DualChannelAudioDataType, representing dual-channel audio.

Return type:

type

classmethod output_data_type()

Specify the output data type for the algorithm.

Returns:

DualChannelAudioDataType, representing dual-channel audio.

Return type:

type

class semantiva.specializations.audio.audio_operations.DualChannelAudioProbe(logger=None)

Bases: DataProbe

A probe for inspecting or monitoring dual-channel (stereo) audio data.

This class implements the DataProbe abstract base class to define operations that accept DualChannelAudioDataType as input. It is typically used for debugging, logging, or analyzing dual-channel audio data within the framework.

Parameters:

logger (Logger | None)

input_data_type()

Returns the expected input data type for the probe.

classmethod input_data_type()

Specify the input data type for the probe.

Returns:

DualChannelAudioDataType, representing dual-channel audio.

Return type:

type

class semantiva.specializations.audio.audio_operations.DualChannelMergerAlgorithm(context_observer=None, logger=None)

Bases: DataAlgorithm

An algorithm to merge dual-channel audio data into a single-channel format.

This class defines operations that accept DualChannelAudioDataType as input and produce SingleChannelAudioDataType as output, suitable for scenarios where stereo audio needs to be downmixed.

Parameters:

  • context_observer (ContextObserver | None)

  • logger (Logger | None)

input_data_type()

Returns the expected input data type.

output_data_type()

Returns the type of data output by the algorithm.

classmethod input_data_type()

Specify the input data type for the algorithm.

Returns:

DualChannelAudioDataType, representing dual-channel audio.

Return type:

type

classmethod output_data_type()

Specify the output data type for the algorithm.

Returns:

SingleChannelAudioDataType, representing single-channel audio.

Return type:

type

class semantiva.specializations.audio.audio_operations.SingleChannelExpanderAlgorithm(context_observer=None, logger=None)

Bases: DataAlgorithm

An algorithm to expand single-channel audio data into dual-channel format.

This class defines operations that accept SingleChannelAudioDataType as input and produce DualChannelAudioDataType as output, suitable for scenarios where mono audio needs to be converted to stereo.

Parameters:

  • context_observer (ContextObserver | None)

  • logger (Logger | None)

input_data_type()

Returns the expected input data type.

output_data_type()

Returns the type of data output by the algorithm.

classmethod input_data_type()

Specify the input data type for the algorithm.

Returns:

SingleChannelAudioDataType, representing single-channel audio.

Return type:

type

classmethod output_data_type()

Specify the output data type for the algorithm.

Returns:

DualChannelAudioDataType, representing dual-channel audio.

Return type:

type
